content: small crochet market bag first decide if you want the smaller or slightly larger bag begin with an h hook for the smaller child size or project bag or a j hook if you want a slightly larger bag more practical for an adult to use at the farmer s market with one strand of sturdy worsted or aran weight yarn make an adjustable loop or chain 6 and join without twisting row 1 double_crochet 8 in the loop slip_stitch into first stitch row 2 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in first stitch then 2 double crochets in each stitch 16 stitches slip_stitch in top of chain 3 row 3 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in same stitch one double_crochet in next stitch two double crochets in following stitch around the circle 24 stitches slip_stitch in top of chain 3 row 4 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in first stitch double_crochet in next 2 double crochets two double crochets in every third stitch around the circle 32 stitches slip_stitch on top of chain 3 space row 5 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in first stitch double_crochet in next 3 double crochets then 2 double crochets in every fourth stitch around the circle 40 stitches slip_stitch on the chain 3 space row 6 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in first stitch double_crochet in next 4 double crochets then 2 double crochets in every fifth stitch around the circle 48 stitches slip_stitch on the chain 3 space row 7 chain 4 counts as one double_crochet and a chain skip one stitch then double_crochet in the next stitch chain one skip the next stitch and double_crochet/chain one around the circle slip_stitch into the chain 4 space row 8-16 chain 4 double_crochet in the next open space created by the chain 1/skip below continue to double_crochet in each space chain one around the circle slip stitching at the end of the round and chaining 4 for the first stitch/chain one at the beginning of each round you will have 10 rounds of the double_crochet/chain one pattern at the end of this section row 17 switch to the j hook if you are using an h for the body of your bag single_crochet in each chain one space around the project then slip_stitch the end of the row row 18 row 18 count the number of stitches around your project divide this number by 4 then divide the number of stitches around the top by 8 chain 1 counts as the first single_crochet and crochet 1/8 of the way around the top using the number that is 1/4 of the way around chain this number plus 4 more chains skip the number of single crochets that is the number divided by 4 then single_crochet that number of stitches chain the same number of stitches as you did the first time skip the same number of stitches then finish the round
